resources.string: Start or stop the proxy (running by default on port 8123)

Polipoid is a wrapper around the 'polipo' proxy. In addition to providing a tray icon it automatically puts polipo into offline mode when the network is disconnected.

For more about polipo see:
 http://www.pps.univ-paris-diderot.fr/~jch/software/polipo 

The method for using a proxy depends greatly on your version of android. Googling 'android 2.2 proxy' or the like should help.
Couldn\'t find config file, please try again.

Using this interface you can upload a configuration file to be used by polipo. Have a look at the polipo manual to find out what can be changed.\nhttp://www.pps.univ-paris-diderot.fr/~jch/software/polipo/polipo.html#Variable-index
You need to install a file chooser application (e.g. Android File Explorer) to use this feature.
